results.name: Least positive integer that is the sum of two squares of positive integers in exactly n ways.
reference: A. Beiler, Recreations in the Theory of Numbers, Dover, pp. 140-141.
link: T. D. Noe and Ray Chandler, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2178 (a(2179) exceeds 1000 digits).
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Square Number
Index entries for sequences related to sums of squares
example: a(0) = 1 as 1 is the least positive integer not expressible as the sum of two squared positives.
